wikipedia_page.main:
Lucy Creamer (born 19 April 1971) is a British professional climber. Creamer was born in Taunton, Somerset, but now lives in Sheffield - a city known for its large climbing community.
After working as an outdoor instructor Creamer became a full-time climber and has entered many climbing competitions.

response: The presentation team use rock climbing techniques to access internal and external parts of each building to illustrate construction techniques and materials and other details not usually visible. The team consists of the architect Dr Jonathan Foyle, the climber Lucy Creamer and camera operator Ian Burton, assisted by a rigging team. Foyle is known for his television presentations of architectural history, which subject he also teaches for Cambridge University's International Division. Creamer provides expert advice and encouragement to Foyle, as well as being a sounding-board for his on-site explanations.
* Climbing Great Buildings (2010) 15-part series, along with champion climber Lucy Creamer
